official-title.#text:
To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of
		  1965 to require criminal background checks for school
		  employees.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Protecting Students from Sexual and
			 Violent Predators Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subpart 2 of part E of
			 title IX of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:IX/pt:E/spt:2

text.#text:
Each State educational agency that receives funds under
				this Act shall have in effect policies and procedures that—

require that
				criminal background checks be conducted for each school employee that
				include—

a search of
				State-based child abuse and neglect registries and databases in the State in
				which the school employee resides and each State in which the school employee
				previously resided;

a Federal Bureau
				of Investigation fingerprint check using the Integrated Automated Fingerprint
				Identification System; and

a search of the
				National Sex Offender Registry established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 19 of the Adam Walsh
				Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006/s:19

text.#text:
prohibit the
				employment of an individual as a school employee if such individual—

refuses to consent
				to a criminal background check under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9537/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
makes a false
				statement in connection with such criminal background check;

has been convicted
				of a felony consisting of—
homicide;

child abuse or
				neglect;

a crime against
				children, including child pornography;

spousal
				abuse;

a
				crime involving rape or sexual assault;
kidnapping;
arson; or

physical
				assault, battery, or a drug-related offense, committed within 5 years of the
				completion of such individual’s criminal background check under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9537/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
has been convicted of any other crime that
				is a violent or sexual crime against a minor;

require that a
				local educational agency or State educational agency that receives information
				from a criminal background check conducted

internal-xref.#tail:
that an individual who
				has applied for employment as a school employee with such agency is a sexual
				predator, report to local law enforcement that such individual has so
				applied;

text.#text:
require that criminal background checks
				conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9537/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
require that each school employee who has
				had a criminal background check under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9537/ss:a/p:1

internal-xref.#tail:
be provided with a copy
				of the background check; and

text.#text:
provide for a timely process by which a
				school employee may appeal, but which does not permit the school employee to be
				employed as a school employee during such appeal, the results of a criminal
				background check conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9537/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
seek appropriate
				relief for any final employment decision based on materially inaccurate or
				incomplete information produced by such background check.

A State
				educational agency may maintain an inventory of all the information from
				criminal background checks conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:9537/ss:a/p:1

internal-xref.#tail:
on school employees
				in the State.

text.#text: In this section:
The term

an employee of, or
				a person seeking employment with, a local educational agency or State
				educational agency, and who has a job duty that results in access to students;
				or

an employee of, or
				a person seeking employment with, a for-profit or nonprofit entity, or local
				public agency, that has a contract or agreement to provide services with a
				school, local educational agency, or State educational agency, and whose job
				duty—

is
				to provide such services; and

results in access
				to students.

term.#tail:
means a person 18
				years of age or older who has been convicted of, or pled guilty to, a sexual
				offense against a
				minor.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding after the
			 item relating to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 2 of the
			 Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
